Biography

David Dhawan, born on August 16, 1955, is an acclaimed Indian film director and producer known for his contributions to the Bollywood film industry. With his exceptional storytelling abilities and a knack for creating hilarious comedies, Dhawan has established himself as one of the most successful directors in the industry.

Dhawan was born and raised in Agartala, Tripura, India. He developed a keen interest in cinema from a young age and was greatly influenced by the works of legendary filmmakers like Guru Dutt and Raj Kapoor. After completing his education, Dhawan moved to Mumbai (formerly Bombay) to pursue a career in the film industry.

In the initial phase of his career, Dhawan started as an assistant director to filmmaker Manmohan Desai. He gained valuable experience and honed his skills while working on Desai's films. This laid a strong foundation for Dhawan's future endeavors as a director.

David Dhawan made his directorial debut with the film Taaqatwar in 1989, starring Sanjay Dutt and Govinda. However, it was the release of the film Shola Aur Shabnam in 1992 that marked a turning point in his career. The movie emerged as a commercial success and established Dhawan as a prominent director in the industry.

Known for his mastery in the comedy genre, David Dhawan has delivered numerous blockbuster hits over the years. His films are known for their rib-tickling humor, witty dialogues, and entertaining storylines. Some of his most notable works include Coolie No. 1, Hero No. 1, Biwi No. 1, Haseena Maan Jaayegi, and Judwaa, among many others.

Dhawan's collaborations with actor Govinda have been particularly successful, creating a magical on-screen duo that entertained audiences with their impeccable comic timing. The duo worked together in several films, forming a formidable partnership that brought laughter and entertainment to millions of viewers.

Throughout his career, David Dhawan has received critical acclaim and numerous awards for his contributions to Indian cinema. He has been honored with several Filmfare Awards, including Best Director and Best Film, recognizing his exceptional talent and achievements in the comedy genre.

Apart from his directorial ventures, Dhawan has also ventured into film production. He has produced films like Main Tera Hero and Chashme Baddoor, further showcasing his versatility and passion for filmmaking.

David Dhawan's films have not only entertained audiences but have also played a significant role in shaping the comedy genre in Bollywood. His unique ability to create light-hearted and entertaining cinema has made him a beloved figure in the Indian film industry.

With his charismatic personality and infectious enthusiasm, Dhawan continues to captivate audiences with his films. His dedication, creativity, and passion for storytelling have made him one of the most celebrated directors in Bollywood, and his contributions to Indian cinema will be remembered for years to come.

Age

David Dhawan was born on August 16, 1955, in Agartala, Tripura, India. As of 2023, he is 67 years old. His zodiac sign is Leo.

Family

David Dhawan, the renowned Indian filmmaker, has a loving and close-knit family. He is married to Karuna Dhawan, and together they have two sons named Rohit Dhawan and Varun Dhawan. Rohit Dhawan, the elder son, followed in his father's footsteps and ventured into the film industry as a director. He made his directorial debut with the successful comedy film Desi Boyz in 2011. Rohit Dhawan is married to Jaanvi Desai, and they have been blessed with a daughter, who brings joy to the Dhawan family. Varun Dhawan, the younger son, is a well-known actor in the Indian film industry. He made his acting debut with the film Student of the Year in 2012 and has since starred in several commercially successful movies. Varun Dhawan's charismatic screen presence and versatile performances have garnered him a massive fan following.

Career

David Dhawan began his career in the film industry as an editor, working on the movie Saaransh in 1984. He later transitioned into directing and became known for his expertise in directing comedy films. One of his notable successes was the 1993 film Ankhen, which starred Govinda, Chunky Pandey, and Kader Khan, and performed exceptionally well at the box office. Another successful venture was Shola Aur Shabnam.

In 2007, Dhawan directed the film Partner, which also achieved significant success. Throughout his career, he has collaborated extensively with actor Govinda. They first worked together in the film Taaqatwar in 1989 and went on to collaborate on a total of 18 films. Some of their notable collaborations include Swarg (1990), Raja Babu (1994), Coolie No. 1 (1995), Hero No. 1 (1997), Bade Miyan Chote Miyan (1998), Haseena Maan Jaayegi (1999), and Partner (2007). Partner also featured Salman Khan and achieved tremendous success, grossing Rs. 300 million in India during its opening week.

David Dhawan's contributions to the film industry have been acknowledged by his inclusion on the board of the Asian Academy of Film & Television and the Asian School of Media Studies. He has received an academy award from Sandeep Marwah, and his expertise has been recognized by his involvement as a judge on television shows like Nach Baliye 3 in 2008 and Hans Baliye.

In 2009, Dhawan reunited with Govinda and Ritesh Deshmukh for the film Do Knot Disturb. Their previous collaboration, Partner, prompted Salman Khan to invite Dhawan and Govinda as guests on his show 10 Ka Dum to celebrate its success.

Top 5 Movies

Coolie No. 1 (1995)

Coolie No. 1 is a hilarious comedy film directed by David Dhawan, starring Govinda and Karisma Kapoor in the lead roles. The story revolves around a young man, Raju, who pretends to be a wealthy businessman to win the heart of a rich girl, Malti. The film showcases Dhawan's signature style of slapstick humor, catchy songs, and energetic dance sequences. Coolie No. 1 became a massive hit and is still remembered for its memorable dialogues and entertaining performances.

Hero No. 1 (1997)

Hero No. 1 is another successful collaboration between David Dhawan and Govinda. The film tells the story of Rajesh Malhotra, a kind-hearted and good-natured man who falls in love with Meena, the daughter of a wealthy businessman. Rajesh disguises himself as a wealthy suitor to win her father's approval. The movie is a delightful blend of comedy, romance, and catchy songs. Dhawan's direction and Govinda's comic timing make Hero No. 1 a thoroughly enjoyable watch.

Judwaa (1997)

Judwaa is an action-comedy film directed by David Dhawan and features Salman Khan in a double role alongside Karisma Kapoor and Rambha. The movie follows the story of twin brothers, Raja and Prem, who are separated at birth. While Raja grows up to be a street-smart tapori (rowdy), Prem becomes a well-mannered and educated young man. The film combines elements of mistaken identity, romance, and high-energy dance numbers, creating a fun-filled entertainer that became a commercial success.

Biwi No. 1 (1999)

Biwi No. 1 is a comedy-drama film directed by David Dhawan, featuring Salman Khan, Karisma Kapoor, and Sushmita Sen in the lead roles. The story revolves around a married couple, Prem and Pooja, whose marriage hits a roadblock when a glamorous woman, Rupali, enters their lives. The film humorously explores the dynamics of relationships, love, and marriage. With its witty dialogues, catchy music, and strong performances, Biwi No. 1 became a box office hit.

Partner (2007)

Partner is a romantic comedy directed by David Dhawan and stars Salman Khan, Govinda, Katrina Kaif, and Lara Dutta. The film follows the story of a love guru, Prem, who helps his clients find their soulmates. However, Prem's own life takes a turn when he falls in love with a clumsy but charming girl, Naina. Partner is known for its humorous dialogues, catchy songs, and the dynamic chemistry between Salman Khan and Govinda. It achieved great success at the box office and is considered one of Dhawan's most entertaining films.

Net Worth

David Dhawan's net worth is estimated to be $20 Million Dollars. David Dhawan's net worth is largely the result of his success as a Indian Director.

Interesting Facts

David Dhawan’s parents named him Rajinder. However, his Catholic neighbours used to call him David and eventually his parents asked him to officially change it to David.

Initially, Dhawan had no plans of joining the film industry; however, when his elder brother, Anil, applied for an acting course at the FTII, he also thought of giving it a try. Thus Dhawan enrolled himself in the same course and institute.

After spending a few months there, he gathered that acting wasn’t his cup of tea. As a result, he abandoned the course mid-way and chose an editing course instead.

Dhawan has directed over 42 movies
